title: Honduran Judge Clears Way for Ex-President to Be Sent to U.S. for Trial
sub_head: Juan Orlando Hernández was indicted by prosecutors in New York in January on drug conspiracy and weapons charges
body:
A Honduran Supreme Court judge ruled he would allow the extradition of former President Juan Orlando Hernández to face trial in New York on charges he helped smuggle tons of cocaine into the U.S. in exchange for millions of dollars in bribes that he used to finance his political career and turn one of the hemisphere’s poorest countries into a violent narco state.
Judge Edwin Francisco Ortez made the decision after spending a day behind closed doors hearing the case, which was submitted by the U.S. Mr. Hernández was indicted by prosecutors in New York in January on drug conspiracy and weapons charges just hours after he stepped down as president. He ruled Honduras for eight years.
